subject: Re: [junit] running out of memory
msgSnippet: ... Sorry, objects. Lazy initialization can also cause the classloading to be deferred as well if these classes don t define any beforeSuite methods (meaning:
messageBody:
On 1/20/06, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
>
> > As you build up your test coverage, you are bound to hit a memory limit
> at
> > some point and keeping all these classes in memory at the same time is a
> > waste.
>
> Do you mean classes or objects?


Sorry, objects.

Lazy initialization can also cause the classloading to be deferred as well
if these classes don't define any beforeSuite methods (meaning: they won't
be needed until we try to run our first test on them).

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
